alert.note: Alert for Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 4:18PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Wichita County through 445 PM CDT... At 418 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles south of Leoti, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, nickel size hail and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Torrential rainfall with this storm may lead to localized flooding. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Wichita County, including the following locations... Lydia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
